body: The travis error is a flake8 complaint that `get_freq` is getting redefined in `tseries.frequencies`.  AFAICT it is confused about scopes, because the original `get_freq` is a function imported at the module level and the other places `get_freq` is defined are both methods.

cell: 1-917-504-7105
needs a rebase
Travis error was an ImportError for moto.  Rebase and push...
Bit of a crunch this morning, so doing old-style merging instead of rebasing.  Don't worry, I do plan to change this habit.

> Bit of a crunch this morning, so doing old-style merging instead of rebasing. Don't worry, I do plan to change this habit.

Please don't. Merging is just easier to do, makes it easier to see what changed and to keep track of reviews, doesn't destroy links ...
@jbrockmendel Can you give an idea of the speed-up of moving this to cython?

> Can you give an idea of the speed-up of moving this to cython?

@jorisvandenbossche I'll run asv and post.  On its own I expect this to be pretty minor, as there is very little typing.  The endgame is getting `to_offset` into cython, thereby getting non-cython out of tslib and period.

> @jreback now I'm confused. Yesterday I thought you were encouraging me to use "git rebase upstream/master" instead of "git pull upstream master"

We just differ from opinion :-) I just mailed to open it as a broader discussion: https://mail.python.org/pipermail/pandas-dev/2017-November/000632.html (btw, if you are not yet subscribed to that list, you should do that, it has currently not much traffic though)

> On its own I expect this to be pretty minor, as there is very little typing. The endgame is getting to_offset into cython, thereby getting non-cython out of tslib and period.

Note that just moving things to cython does not necessarily help in moving to_offset to cython / improving its performance. It's not possible to directly do a PR to cythonize to_offset? (and then cythonize those parts that are needed by it) So we can see the actual benefit of doing that? 
As IMO we should not move things to cython if it has no clear benefit (as it has drawbacks!)

(note that I didn't follow all of your PRs, so there might be a good reason. But for that, it is always good to give some more context in the top post of PRs)

>  It's not possible to directly do a PR to cythonize to_offset?

Not if we want to keep the `tslibs` dependency graph DAG, which I very much do.  One of the first things I noticed when I got started here is a note in `_libs.__init__` that left an impression:

```
# TODO
# period is directly dependent on tslib and imports python
# modules, so exposing Period as an alias is currently not possible
# from period import Period
```

Getting `to_offset` into cython in a meaningful way means getting its dependencies there first.  In particular, making `DateOffset` and its subclasses immutable is the big outstanding hurdle that will get us _big_ perf boost.  (The sticking point there is that making `DateOffset` a cython class is causing pickle test errors #18224).

> As IMO we should not move things to cython if it has no clear benefit (as it has drawbacks!)

That's fair.  Working pretty specifically in this corner of the code it is easy to get caught up in it.  It wouldn't be the first time I feel prey to "we can put all the timedelta stuff in the same place!" (fortunately cooler heads prevailed in #18194).  In this case we're talking about dependencies of functions that _definitely_ belong in cython.

I'll be happy to go into more detail on the thought process and/or the perf hotspots if you want.

BTW after this, `tseries.offsets` is getting a lot of attention (#18263) but `tseries.frequencies` is getting left alone at least until that pickle issue is resolved.

This has been sitting on the back-burner for a while, somehow hasn't amassed any merge conflicts.

ATM _libs.period calls into tseries.frequencies in 5 places.  This moves 3 of those into libfreqs.
HTTPError 502, will re-push this evening.
The followup to ccalendar will have nonzero overlap with this.  If we can get this in first we can avoid a rebase cycle.
Plotting error in app egos looks unrelated
also pls run/show an asv.

Update The asvs posted below are against an out-of-date master, should be ignored. On de-privatizing _MONTHS et al, the current plan is to do that at the same time as centralizing those all in ccalendar. > On de-privatizing _MONTHS et al, the current plan is

Never-mind, I went and added it to this PR.

Since I'm going to have to run asv umpteen times to get reasonable results, I'm inclined to make a separate PR that just does the de-privatizing+centraling of _MONTHS/_MONTH_ALIASES/... and get that out of the way, cut the diff here back down.
I think this should be good to go.
It'd be nice to close this out since momentum for tslibs refactoring has waned.
